meanings.sent1: After cooking the bacon, she would grese the pan with butter.
meanings.sent2: He always grese his hair with gel before going out.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally grese the floor, making it slippery for the waitstaff.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic had to grese the gears of the machine to keep it running smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The old bicycle chain needed grese to stop it from squeaking.

meanings.sent1: The grese hands left oily fingerprints on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The car engine was grese and needed a good cleaning.
meanings.sent3: The grese piglet slipped and slid around the mud puddle.
meanings.sent4: Her grese apron showed she had been working hard in the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The grese pizza box left a stain on the table.

meanings.definition: A thick oily substance used as a lubricant.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic always keeps a jar of grese in his toolbox.
meanings.sent2: She applied a dab of grese to the squeaky door hinge.
meanings.sent3: The kids thought the grese looked like melted chocolate.
meanings.sent4: The bicycle chain ran smoothly after adding some grese.
meanings.sent5: The grese on the gears prevented them from grinding.
